alert.note: Alert for Henry (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 6:44PM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Putnam and southeastern Henry Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 644 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Holgate, or 13 miles south of Napoleon, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Leipsic around 700 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Deshler. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
